meanings.definition: To think deeply or carefully about something
meanings.sent1: I like to contemplate the stars at night and wonder about the universe.
meanings.sent2: She sat quietly to contemplate her next move in the game.
meanings.sent3: As I contemplate what to have for dinner, I realize I have no food in the fridge!
meanings.sent4: Contemplating the vastness of the ocean, I felt a sense of peace wash over me.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet of the library, I could contemplate the meaning of life.

meanings.sent1: He likes to contemplate different options before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: Contemplate the consequences of your actions before you act.
meanings.sent3: I contemplate whether to wear a hat or sunglasses on this sunny day.
meanings.sent4: Contemplating the idea of time travel, I imagined all the possibilities.
meanings.sent5: She would often contemplate the beauty of nature while hiking in the mountains.

meanings.sent1: The artist would contemplate the painting before adding the final brushstrokes.
meanings.sent2: Contemplate the intricate details of the sculpture to appreciate its beauty.
meanings.sent3: I contemplate the cute puppy in the window, wishing I could take it home.
meanings.sent4: Contemplating the old photograph, memories flooded back into my mind.
meanings.sent5: She would sit by the window and contemplate the changing colors of the sky.
